definition: at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

sentences.english: Tears are sometimes rolling down from your cheek whenever thinking of the past painful hardship and hurting experience.
sentences.chinese: 每當想起過去痛苦與傷心，眼淚總是潸然流下。

sentences.english: Whenever sad time, god of destiny will be a silver pen on paper drawing a circle.
sentences.chinese: 每當悲傷一次，命運之神便會用銀筆在紙上畫一個圈。

sentences.english: In deep night, when on the narrow bridge the traveler trembles.
sentences.chinese: 每當深夜，浪遊者在山間小路哆嗦戰慄。

sentences.english: To tell you the truth, when I have trouble, I always ask her for advice.
sentences.chinese: 跟你說老實話，每當我有麻煩時總向她徵求意見。

sentences.english: As often as I praised him for his hard work, he kept silent.
sentences.chinese: 每當我表揚他工作勤奮時，他總是默不做聲。

sentences.english: Its software actually improves as each new user downloads it.
sentences.chinese: 其軟件，每當有新用戶下載，就確實得到改進。

sentences.english: Whenever it recognizes something in the document, it generates an event.
sentences.chinese: 每當它識別出文檔中的某些內容，就會生成一個事件。

sentences.english: However, when it comes tothis matter, different people have different views.
sentences.chinese: 然而，每當說到這個話題，不同的人有不同的意見。

sentences.english: Every time Saturn moves through a house we learn a lesson pertaining to that house.
sentences.chinese: 每當土星走完一宮，我們便可以藉此學到點什麼。

sentences.english: They always turn to me when they are in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 每當碰到困難時，他們總是回來找我。

sentences.english: Every time we recall a long-term memory, it becomes malleable.
sentences.chinese: 每當我們回憶起一段長期記憶，它都是具有可塑性的。

sentences.english: A fault message should be generated whenever a failure occurs at an intermediary.
sentences.chinese: 每當中介體發生故障時，都應該生成錯誤消息。

sentences.english: Whenever someone asks you ‘What is personal development?
sentences.chinese: 每當有人問你“什麼是個人發展？”

sentences.english: Whenever you reroll, you must abide by the result of the second roll.
sentences.chinese: 每當你重擲時，你都必須接受第二次擲骰的結果。

sentences.english: Whenever a cold wind blows in, they tremble and chatter their branches.
sentences.chinese: 每當寒風吹起，它們就顫抖起來，枝葉直打戰。

sentences.english: For example, each time a new product name is added, you can have it trigger a batch update .
sentences.chinese: 例如，每當添加新產品名時，可以讓它觸發批量更新。

definition: once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
to talk about/to mention/(preposition) as for
from time to time/now and then/occasionally/frequently
